meanings.definition: The collection of money or goods during a religious service.
meanings.sent1: During the offertory, people give money to support the church.
meanings.sent2: The offertory at the church was generous this Sunday.
meanings.sent3: The offertory basket seemed to be overflowing with coins.
meanings.sent4: Her generosity during the offertory was like a beacon of light in the dim church.
meanings.sent5: The offertory is a crucial part of the church service, helping to fund various activities.

meanings.definition: The act of presenting gifts or offerings to a deity.
meanings.sent1: The priest performed the offertory with reverence and devotion.
meanings.sent2: During the offertory, the worshippers offered fruits and flowers to the deity.
meanings.sent3: The offertory ceremony was a beautiful display of gratitude.
meanings.sent4: Her offertory to the deity was a heartfelt gesture of thankfulness.
meanings.sent5: The offertory ritual symbolizes the bond between the worshippers and their deity.

meanings.definition: A musical composition played during the collection of offerings in a religious service.
meanings.sent1: The choir sang a beautiful offertory hymn during the church service.
meanings.sent2: The offertory music added a solemn atmosphere to the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The offertory melody echoed through the church, filling the space with harmony.
meanings.sent4: The offertory piece was so moving that it brought tears to the eyes of the congregation.
meanings.sent5: The offertory composition was a perfect blend of reverence and beauty.
